wikipedia_page.main: Ronald Center (2 April 1913 – 18 April 1973) was a Scottish composer.

response: * Ronald Center (1913–1973), composer, lived there from 1943 until his death in 1973, teaching first at the Gordon Schools, then privately.
*Scottish composer Ronald Center wrote a symphony called The Coming of Cuchulain, first performed by the Scottish Orchestra, conducted by Warwick Braithwaite, in 1944.
* Ronald Center (1917-1973), music teacher from 1943 to 1949.
